title: The Definitive Guide for "Small Influencers": How to Get PR Packages (2025)
excerpt: You don't need 100k followers to get PR. This definitive 2025 guide shows small influencers (under 10k followers) how to leverage their high engagement to land PR packages from their dream brands.
content:
The Small Influencer Advantage: Your Complete PR Package Guide

This is the biggest myth in the creator economy: "You need 10k, 50k, or 100k followers to get brand deals." It's wrong. Brands are now investing more in 'small' and 'micro' influencers (1k-15k followers) than ever before. Why? Because you have the one thing mega-influencers have lost: authentic community and high engagement. This guide is your complete playbook on how to stop feeling 'too small' and start leveraging your power to get PR packages and paid collabs in 2025.

Stop Pitching, Start Getting Pitched

Newcollab is the platform built for creators of all sizes. Post your unique content ideas and let top brands bid directly on your projects, regardless of your follower count.

Why Small Influencers Are Winning in 2025

Your follower count isn't your main asset; your engagement rate is. Brands know this:

  • Sky-High Engagement: A micro-influencer with 5k followers often has a 5-8% engagement rate, while an account with 1M+ followers might only get 1-2%. Your audience is listening.
  • Genuine Trust: Your followers see you as a real person, not a walking advertisement. Your recommendations carry more weight.
  • Niche Authority: You are an expert in your specific niche (e.g., vegan skincare, retro gaming). Brands want to tap into that focused audience.
  • Affordability & ROI: Brands can partner with 10 different micro-influencers for the price of one mega-influencer, reaching 10 unique audiences and generating diverse, authentic content.

Step 1: Prepare Your Profile for "Brand-Readiness"

Before you pitch, your 'shop window' (your social profile) needs to be perfect.

  • Crystal-Clear Bio: State who you are, what you do, and who you do it for. Example: "NYC Creator helping you find the best affordable style."
  • Obvious Niche: A brand manager should know your niche in 3 seconds. Is it fashion? Food? Tech? Make it obvious.
  • High-Quality Content: Your last 9 posts are your portfolio. Ensure they are well-lit, high-resolution, and on-brand.
  • Contactable: Have a professional email address clearly listed in your bio.
  • Engagement Rate: Add your engagement rate to your bio (e.g., "5% engagement rate") to immediately show your value.

Use Newcollab to showcase your content ideas to brands.

Step 3: How to Pitch (Your Most Important Email)

You've found a brand. Now you need to pitch them. A generic 'collab?' DM won't work. You need a professional email that shows your value. We built a complete guide with 5 templates for this.

Read it here: 5 "Copy-Paste" PR Pitch Templates That Get Replies (For Micro-Influencers)

The key is to use the "Small Influencer Pitch" (Template 3) which emphasizes your high engagement rate, not your follower count.

Step 4: Turn Your First "Free" PR Package into a Paid Deal

Your first collab will likely be 'gifted' (free product in exchange for content). This is your audition. Over-deliver! Create amazing content. Then, use our "Thank You & Next Steps" email template (in the link above) to open the door for a paid partnership. This is how you build a sustainable business.

Common Mistakes That Kill Your PR Chances

Avoid these pitfalls that prevent small influencers from getting PR packages:

  • Focusing Only on Follower Count: Don't mention your follower count unless it's impressive. Lead with engagement rate instead.
  • Generic Pitches: "Hey, I love your brand!" gets ignored. Reference specific products and campaigns.
  • Poor Content Quality: Brands judge you by your last 9 posts. Make them portfolio-worthy.
  • No Clear Niche: Being "lifestyle" is too broad. Be specific: "sustainable fashion" or "vegan skincare."
  • Unprofessional Communication: Use proper grammar, professional email addresses, and business language.

Building Long-Term Brand Relationships

Turn one-time PR packages into ongoing partnerships:

  • Over-Deliver on Content: Create more content than requested, with high production value.
  • Track Your Results: Share engagement metrics and audience feedback with brands.
  • Stay Professional: Meet deadlines, communicate clearly, and maintain brand guidelines.
  • Follow Up Strategically: Use our email templates to convert gifted collabs into paid partnerships.
  • Build Your Portfolio: Document all successful collaborations for future pitches.

Why Choose Newcollab?

Newcollab eliminates the need for pitching:

  • No More Pitching: Brands find and contact you directly
  • Verified Brands: 1,000+ authentic brands seeking creators
  • Clear Terms: Transparent rates and expectations
  • Secure Payments: Protected transactions and fast payouts

Join Newcollab to start receiving brand offers.

Conclusion: You Are Ready.

Being a 'small influencer' is not a disadvantage; it's your biggest opportunity. You have the trust and engagement that brands are desperate for. Follow this guide, be professional, and pitch your value. And when you're ready to have brands come to you, post your best ideas on Newcollab and let them see your creative power for themselves.

faq.question: Do I really need a media kit if I'm a small influencer?
faq.answer: Yes! A media kit makes you look professional and serious. It shows a brand you treat this like a business, not a hobby. Use our free template to make one in 20 minutes.

faq.question: Is engagement rate really more important than followers?
faq.answer: For most brands, yes. A high engagement rate (3-8%) shows that your small audience is loyal, active, and trusts what you say. This is more valuable than a 1M follower account with a 1% engagement rate.

faq.question: What's the minimum follower count to get PR packages?
faq.answer: There is no magic number. Some creators get PR with as few as 1,000 followers by having a hyper-niche audience and amazing content quality. Focus on your professionalism and engagement, not the count.

faq.question: Should I work for free (gifted collabs) as a small creator?
faq.answer: Think of your first 1-3 gifted collabs as your audition. You build your portfolio and prove your value. Use our email templates to quickly turn those successes into paid partnerships.

faq.question: How do I find brands that work with small influencers?
faq.answer: Look for brands with open application forms, affiliate programs, or ambassador programs. Many beauty, fashion, and lifestyle brands actively seek micro-influencers. Use our comprehensive brand lists to find opportunities.
